subject: Photography
title: RAW vs. JPEG
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on RAW vs. JPEG.

hook.text: Your camera offers two file types: RAW keeps everything the sensor captured. JPEG throws most of it away.

buildup.text: JPEG applies processing â€” sharpening, color, compression â€” and saves a final image. RAW saves the unprocessed data.

discovery.text: RAW files are larger but contain far more information: wider dynamic range, more color depth, more editing room.

twist.text: A JPEG is a finished print. A RAW file is a digital negative. You can develop it differently every time.

climax.text: Professional photographers almost always shoot RAW. The flexibility to recover highlights and shadows is priceless.

punchline.text: JPEG decides for you. RAW lets you decide later.

quiz.question: What is the main advantage of shooting in RAW format?
options: It preserves all sensor data for maximum editing flexibility
It looks better straight from the camera
